manzils.text: Exalted is He Who took His servant one night from the sacred masjid (in Mecca) to the masjid in Jerusalem _ the vicinity of which We have blessed _ so that We may show him Our signs. Surely, He listens and hears all
We awarded Musa the book, and deemed it to be the directive for the Israelites, that they should not accept anyone other than Me as their Lord
Oh you, the sons of those whom We put aboard (a ship) with Nooh! Surely, he was a grateful person
In the book, We foretold the destiny of Israelites, "Twice you will cause severe mischief in the land and exceed greatly in arrogance

At the time of the first prediction (mischief), We sent (in combat) against you, one of Our powerful nations. They were well versed in warfare and they stormed through your homes. The promise had to come true
Then (when you repented), We restored you back to power. We bolstered you with resources and offspring and caused you to abound in numbers. (And said)

Your good deeds are for your own good, and similarly, your bad deeds are to afflict your own self!" At the time of the second prediction, (We sent another nation) to mangle your faces and to run over your masjid just like the first time, and to lay in ruin everything they laid their hands on
Maybe (now) your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you repeat (your offense), We shall reinstate (Our punishment). We have fashioned hell to be a prison for the unbelievers
Indeed, this Qur´an leads on to an appropriate and secure path. It gives the good news to those who perform righteous deeds, that theirs is a great reward
And We have prepared a painful punishment for those who do not believe in the afterlife
Man covets wickedness as if it were something admirable; man happens to be hasty

We appointed both the night and the day as signs. One of the signs _ the night _ We made dim, while We made the day bright and full of light, so that you may seek the blessings of your Lord, and so that you may count the years and have a measure of time. Thus, We have explained everything in detail
We have forced each one´s actions to hang around his neck. On the Day of Judgment, We will bring out his record of deeds; he will find it an open book
Read your record! Today, even you shall suffice to evaluate your own self

The one who adopts the guidance (of the Qur´an) does so only for his own benefit. The one who strays also does so for his own self. No soul shall carry another´s burden! We never inflict punishment, unless We have already sent around messengers

When We resolve to ruin a town, (and before We actually destroy it), We first order its affluent inhabitants (to obey). They carry on their lives of sin. So the prediction (against them) comes to pass. Thereafter, We finish them off completely
Many towns have We destroyed after Nooh. Your Lord is Aware, and He is enough to watch over the sins of His created beings

We grant the wishes in this (transitory) world _ whatever We please and for whomever We decide. For the one who prefers this temporal existence, We have prepared hell (in the hereafter). He will join it, cursed and ostracized
Provided he is a believer, anyone who desires (the rewards of) the afterlife and strives effectively for it, will discover that his efforts have found acceptance
We bestow the bounties of your Lord to both _ this group as well as that. The grant of your Lord is not restricted
But observe how We, in this world, excel some over others; and the afterlife is bigger in status and higher in esteem
Do not associate any god with Allah, else you shall find yourself cursed and abandoned

Your Lord has decreed that you should not worship anyone other than Him, and that you treat your parents well. When either, or both of them, reach an old age do not grumble and do not be angry with them. Rather, always have kind words to say to them
Be responsive to them and treat them with kindness and compassion, and say, "Oh my Lord. Have mercy on them as they brought me up when I was a small child
Your Lord is fully aware of the thoughts that cross your mind. If you are righteous (then remember), your Lord forgives those who turn to Him in repentance
And honor the rights of the kinsfolk, the poor and needy, and the homeless; and do not be overly wasteful
Surely, the spendthrift are the brothers of Shaitan; and Shaitan is ungrateful to his Lord
Speak to them politely even if you must decline them, because you might still be awaiting and looking for the blessings of your Lord
Do not have your hands restrained to your neck (do not be stingy), nor stretch them free and unfettered (nor be a spendthrift), lest you later feel sorry and constrained
Your Lord certainly provides the provisions in abundance _ or limits them _ to whomever He pleases. Indeed, He is all Knowing, and Watchful over His servants
Do not, out of fear of poverty, put your offspring to death. We shall provide them as well as you, the means of life. Killing your offspring is a blunder of a grave proportion
And do not even wander close to extra marital sex. Indeed, adultery is a way of decadence

And do not kill anyone. Allah has prohibited it, except when it is rightful and befitting (and corresponds to the crime). We have awarded a right (of redress) to the heir of a person wrongfully killed. But let him not exceed the bounds and overdo in (his quest to seek redress by) killing. He is to be helped
And do not approach the assets of an orphan except with noble intentions, right until he comes of age. Honor your pacts! Surely you are answerable for your pacts
When you measure, be exact (do not curtail); and when you weigh, use the correct and proper scales (do not diminish). This is beneficial for you, and better in consequences
Do not take a stand about anything you have no knowledge of. Indeed, the ears the eyes and the heart have all to render an account
And do not walk on the earth arrogantly. You will neither wear down the earth, nor match the stature of the mountains
All of that is wrong and despised by your Lord
This wisdom is revealed to you by your Lord! Do not accept any god other than Allah; else you will be hurled into hell _ cursed and ostracized
(Oh you who accept gods other than Allah), did your Lord favor you with sons while He settled on angels as daughters for Himself? Surely what you utter is a grave thing
We have repeatedly explained matters in this Qur´an, so they may come to their senses. But it has only intensified their aversion (for the truth)
Say
Glorified is He! Exalted and far above what they assert

The seven heavens, the earth, and all those who exist therein, glorify Him. There isn´t anything that does not chant His praises! But you fail to (hear their chants, or) comprehend their manner of praise. Surely, He is Gentle and Forgiving
As you recite the Qur´an, We station an invisible shield between you and those who do not believe in the afterlife
We have encased their hearts in covers, so they understand nothing; and their ears are plugged with corks. When you mention none but your Lord in the Qur´an, they scornfully turn their backs on you

We know (their motives) very well. We know what they (want to) hear when they listen to you closely! When the evildoers talk secretly (with their companions), they say, "You are merely following a man possessed
See! How they depict you? They have strayed off and cannot find the way
They ask, "Once we turn into dust and bones, will we be raised back to a renewed existence
Say, "(Yes! Indeed, even if you) turn into stone or steel

Or any other matter which, in your mind is harder (to resurrect)." They will say, "Who will bring us back?" Say, "The One who brought you into being the first time!" Then, they will shake their heads at you and say, "When will that happen?" Say, "It might be close at hand
When He orders you to emerge on that day, you will comply (and come out) singing praises for Him. You will assume that you had stayed on this earth only for a brief while
Tell My servants to always say the right thing! Surely, Shaitan incites them to do evil. Shaitan is the professed enemy of the human beings
Your Lord knows your circumstances very well. If He pleases He will have mercy on you, and He will punish you if He so please. (Oh Muhammad, SAW) We did not appoint you a manager over them
Your Lord knows all those in the heavens and the earth. He has exalted some messengers over others; He gave Da´ood the Zaboor (the book ´Psalm´ in Bible)
Say, "Call those you claim (to be gods) beside Him. They do not possess any ability either to remove, or to modify any hardship
They themselves pray to Him and vie each other to seek the means to get closer to Him. They hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord deserves to be feared
There is no town that We will not destroy _ or punish severely _ before the Day of Judgment. This is inscribed in the book of decrees

Nothing prevents Us from producing miracles. But the earlier people had rejected them! We assigned the camel as a proof for the people of ´Samood´, but they committed an outrage. We only display signs to serve as a warning

(Remember) We said to you that your Lord has confined and contained people. We appointed the vision, _ the one we showed you _ and the mention of the cursed tree (the tree of ´zaqum´) in the Qur´an to be a trial for the people. We alerted them. Yet, it only increased their defiance immensely
When We told the angels to fall prostrate before Adam they did, except Iblees! He said "Shall I fall prostrate before the one You have fashioned from clay
He said, "Look at him! You gave him precedence over me? If You give me an opportunity till the Day of Judgment, I will outwit and mislead their entire generations! (Only) a few will escape my lure
Said, "Get out of here! Hell is the just recompense, a plentiful penalty for both _ you and those of them who follow you

Tempt and allure them _ anyone among them you can _ with your sly talk. Raid them with your horses and men, bamboozle a share in their wealth and children, and hold out (false) promises for them." Surely Shaitan´s promise is nothing but an illusion
Of course, you shall have no hold over My servants; your Lord is sufficient as a Trustee
Your Lord makes the ship sail in the ocean so you could seek His blessings. Indeed, He is ever so merciful towards you
When trouble strikes you at sea, all those you invoke except Him, vanish (from your consciousness). And when He rescues you (and leads you) back to shore, you again turn away! Man is most ungrateful
Do you then feel secure that He will not cause you to sink and go under even on dry land? Or send hurricanes upon you and no one will be there to guard you
Or are you sure that He will not make you go back to sea for a second time, send a cyclone upon you and drown you for your disbelief? Then, you will find no one to assist you against Us
Indeed, We have honored the descendants of Adam. We let them move about in the land and sea, provided them wholesome food, and markedly excelled them over many of Our other created species
That day, We will summon all human beings with their record of deeds. Those given their records in their right (hand) will read it (eagerly). They shall not be wronged a bit
The one who (refuses to see, and so) does not see in this life, will be blind in the afterlife; he shall be farther away from the way
(Oh prophet!) They almost succeeded in enticing you away from Our revelations, in almost getting you to declare something contrary to Our revelations. They would have then called you a friend
Had We not kept you staunch, you would surely have begun to lean a little towards them
If so, We would have you taste the torment _ twice as much in life and twice as severe after death. You would not find any helper against Us
They had stirred you up enough and had almost succeeded in driving you out of the land. If so, they too, had not stayed behind much longer
This was Our established practice with every messenger We sent prior to you. You will not detect any departure in Our practice
And stand in prayers from sunset till dusk, and recite the Qur´an at dawn. Surely, the recitation of the Qur´an at dawn is well attended (by angels)
And prior to dawn, perform the tahajjud (non-obligatory) prayer at night. Your Lord may elevate you to the most exalted status (in heaven)
And say, "Oh Lord, usher me into the threshold (of events in life) with the truth; and take me through the outcome (of events) with the truth, and by Your grace appoint for me a mighty ally
And say, "The truth is here and falsehood has ceased to be! Indeed, falsehood is ever bound to vanish
That which We revealed in the Qur´an is the mercy and the cure for the believers, and it only multiplies the losses of the evil doers
Man stays aloof and disregards (the message) when We make (life) pleasant for him, and despairs when he encounters a calamity
Each one acts according to his own way. Your Lord knows better those, who are well guided and on the (straight) path
They ask your opinion about the ´Rooh´ (the soul)! Say, "The ´Rooh´ (the soul) is by the command of your Lord. The knowledge imparted to you is just so scanty
Surely, if We please We could revoke the knowledge revealed to you thus far. Then, you will find nothing to promote your cause with Us
Other than mercy from your Lord! Indeed, His favors upon you are enormous
Say, "If the humans and jinn were to assemble in an attempt to create anything akin to this Qur´an, they would definitely fail, even if they assisted each other
In this Qur´an, We have thoroughly explained all sorts of examples. But most folks reject everything and insist upon disbelieving
They say, "We would never believe you unless you could cause springs to gush out of the earth
Or (unless) you owned orchards of dates and grapes, and commandeered rivers to flow through them
Or (else, we dare you to) make the sky tumble down upon us in pieces _ like you claim it might _ and have Allah and His angels appear (face to face) before us

(We might believe you) if your house was made of gold, or you were to rise up into the sky. And we would only trust your ascension if you brought down a book for us to read (and verify)!" Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Am I not just a human being appointed to be His messenger
Nothing prevented people from accepting the guidance once it had arrived, except that they cynically raised the question, "Has Allah appointed a human being to be His messenger
Say, "Had angels populated the earth, _ moving about peacefully in it _ We would certainly have sent another angel from heaven as a messenger for them
Say, "Allah is a sufficient witness between you and me. Indeed He watches over His servants and is well Aware

The one whom Allah shows the way is indeed well guided! And you will not find any helper other than Him, for the one whom Allah leads astray. We will gather all such people on the Day of Judgment. Blind, dumb and deaf, they shall lie flat on their faces. Hell is to be their abode! We shall ignite the hellfire into a blazing inferno whenever it begins to subside
Such shall be their punishment. They rejected Our signs and asked, "Once we are bones and bits, will we be awakened into a renewed existence

Do they not see? Allah Who created the heavens and the earth, is capable of creating the likes of them (anew), and of assigning a specific time (for them). There is no doubt about it. The evil doers insist upon disbelief
Say, "Even if you had treasures of what my Lord blessed you with, you would still, for fear of poverty, hold it back (not spend it)." Man is indeed stingy
We had granted Musa nine very clear proofs. Ask the children of Israel! When (the proofs) appeared before them, the pharaoh said, "Indeed, Oh Musa, I think you are a man possessed
Musa said, "You of course know that these signs are definitely the eye opening proofs from the Lord of the heavens and the earth! Indeed, oh Pharaoh, I think you are ready to be ruined
Then, he resolved to dislodge them (the children of Israel) from the land, but We drowned him and all those with him
Later, to the children of Israel We said, "Inhabit the earth till the promise of the afterlife is fulfilled. Then, We will bring you out as a crowd
We revealed it (the Qur´an) as an absolute truth and it came (to you) as an absolute truth! In fact, We have appointed you as just a bearer of glad tidings, and as a Warner
We have segmented this Qur´an in parts, so you may recite it to the people a little at a time. We have revealed it gradually, step by step
Say, "You may believe in this Qur´an or choose not to. But, when it is read to those who know the scriptures, they (are overwhelmed, and) fall down on their faces in prostration
And they say, "Our Lord is exalted. Our Lord´s promise shall definitely happen
They fall down on their faces, choked up and sobbing. It (the Qur´an) fills them with humbleness

Say, "Call Him Allah, or call him Rehman. Whichever name you call Him by, (remember) His attributes are the most beautiful. During your ´salat´, do not raise your voice too loud, nor lower it to a virtual whisper. Rather, adopt a moderate tone

And say, "All praise is for Allah Who did not beget a son, and Who shares the Lordship of His domain with none! And He (has no weakness, therefore) requires no friend to mask any weakness. So, Glorify Him for His Greatness and Majesty
All the praise belongs to Allah, Who revealed the book to His servant, and in it is included nothing queer

(It is) straightforward, to sound a prior warning about His stern punishment, and to deliver the happy news to the believers, _ those of them with good deeds _ that theirs shall be the bountiful rewards
In it (the paradise), they shall reside forever
And to admonish those who claim that Allah has begotten a son
Regarding that, neither they nor their forefathers had any knowledge. Presumptuous are the words that escape their lips! What they utter is nothing but a falsehood
Would you, then, be overcome with sorrow and agonize over their refusal to accept this message (contained in the Qur´an)
We have, in fact, fashioned everything in this world as mere adornments in order to test them! To see who amongst them performs the righteous deeds
And We are definitely going to convert the earth into a bone-dry barren plateau
Do you regard the companions of the cave and the inscription tablet (upon the cave) as exceptional marvels among Our signs
Those young men sought refuge in the cave and said, "Our Lord! By Your grace, grant us Your mercy and resolve our affairs suitably
So, in that cave We lulled them to sleep for many years
Then, (many years later) We awakened them so We may know which of their groups correctly estimates the length of their stay in the cave
We narrate to you their true tale. The young men had faith in their Lord, and We enhanced them in guidance

We fortified their hearts because they stood firm and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth! We shall call upon no god other than Him. Else, we shall have severely exceeded the bounds
This nation of ours accepts gods other than Him. Why do they not give a valid justification in support? Who then, is more evil than the one inventing lies about Allah

Seek refuge in that cave, now that you have parted company with them, as well as those they worship other than Allah. Your Lord will shower His mercy upon you and will attend to your needs and comforts

(Had you been there) you would see (the rays of) the sun _ as it rises and sets _ falling obliquely across the right of the cave and turning away past its left, while the men lay in the midst (of the cave). These are the signs of Allah. The rightly guided is the one whom Allah guides. You will not find any patron to guide the one who is led astray

You would think they were awake, although they were asleep. We rolled them on their sides _ right and left. With outstretched limbs, their dog lay close to the entrance (of the cave). Had you just caught a glimpse of them, you would be struck with terror and you would turn around and flee

Thus We awakened them so they may question one another. One of them asked, "How long did we stay (here)?" Others responded, "A day! Perhaps less!" They all said, "Our Lord alone knows how long we stayed (in this cave). Let us send one of us to the town with this coin. With it, let him buy and bring to us the best, most wholesome food. And let him proceed with caution. Let no one know about you
If they overcome you they may stone you to death, or compel you to rejoin their faith. In the later case, you will never ever be successful

In that miraculous manner, We made them (the people) stumble upon (that cave). So that they would know for sure that Allah´s promise is real, and that there is no doubt about the hour (of judgment). But instead, they carried on their dispute and said, "Let us build a monument over them. Only their Lord knows the truth about them!" Those who were in charge said, "We shall definitely turn the site into a place of worship

They will say, "(That they were) three, the fourth was their dog." Others also conjecture (and put the figure at) five, counting the dog six. Still others say, "Seven! Their dog was the eighth." Say, "My Lord knows their true number! Others know only very little." So, do not discuss that about them except cursorily, nor inquire anyone about them
And regarding anything, do not say, "I will do that tomorrow

(Rather add), "If Allah pleases!" (Insha Allah)! Should you forget this, then remember your Lord (when you recall) and say, "Perhaps, my Lord will lead me towards that which is more appropriate, and a sensible conduct
They stayed in that cave for three centuries, and nine more years

And say, "Allah knows exactly how long they stayed! To Him belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth! He hears (everything) clearly, and He sees (everything) plainly. They have no patrons besides Him, and He includes none in His decisions and domain
And recite (without modification) the revelation from the book of your Lord. No one may change the words of your Lord! (If you did) you will not find any safe place from Him

Be contented with yourself and with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure. Do not turn your eyes away from them, nor seek the allure of the life of this world. Do not follow anyone who slams his mind shut upon Our advice, follows his own whims and is immoderate in his affairs

Say, "This is the truth! It is from your Lord! So, (now) whoever wants may believe it. If anyone wishes to disbelieve, let him." For the evildoers We have prepared a fire. Like a canopy of conflagration, it will surround them completely. They shall plead for help and shall be treated with water _ more like boiling oil _ which will scald their mouths. A miserable drink served in a wretched place
And We will definitely not waste the rewards of the believers _ those who do good deeds

These are the ones! There exists for them an eternal paradise with rivers flowing right through. As ornaments, they shall don bracelets made of gold, and their garments will be made of lush green silk and brocade. They shall rest poised on elevated thrones. What an excellent apparel in an exquisite place
And quote the parable of the two men. We gave one of them two gardens of grapes, each bordered with date trees. Between (these gardens) We placed cultivated fields of green crops
The vine gardens held back nothing. Both of them bore their fruit to the maximum. We ran a stream between the two gardens
And thus he benefited a lot. While talking to his friend once, he said, "I am better than you in wealth as well as slaves, sons and other personnel
While entering his garden he committed an outrage upon his own self (he was boastful and cynical). He said, "I do not think all this will ever perish
The hour (of judgment) I think, will not occur. If at all I am sent back to my Lord, I shall find even better bounties reserved for me
His companion conversed with him and said, "Aren´t you being ungrateful to the One Who created you; first from dust then from a drop of semen, and then shaped you into a man
As far as I am concerned, Allah is my Lord. I will never associate anyone with my Lord
So, upon entering your garden, why did you not say, ´If Allah wills! (Insha Allah)´. There is no power except that of Allah! (At present) you find me possessing fewer children and riches than you do
It is possible that my Lord may yet grant me a better garden, while he may strike yours (with a bolt) from the blue, leaving it slippery and barren
Or its water may sink deep underground, and you will be unable to retrieve it

(Destruction) closed in on his fruit all around. He wrung his hands in remorse and lamented over what he had spent (and lost) on the garden. It lay in ruin, dreary and desolate. He said, "If only I hadn´t committed a ´shirk´ (ascribed associates) with my Lord
Except Allah nobody could help him, nor could he help himself
At that time (he knew that) the actual authority belongs only to Allah, the real and true (God). The rewards and consequences He bestows are far better

And explain to them by quoting this example: the life of this world is like water We sent down from the sky. The plants assimilate it and become fresh and green. Later they turn into chaff, which the wind scatters around. Indeed, Allah has mastery over all things
The wealth and children are mere adornments for the life of this world. In the eyes of Allah, the good deeds one leaves behind are better in terms of expectations and outcome
You will see the earth turned into an even field when We cause the mountains to become pulverized (into clouds of dust). We will gather all of them together. None shall be absent

They shall be made to line up before their Lord in rows. (Allah will say), "Now! You have arrived before Us just as We created you the first time! And you thought We would not appoint a time (of reckoning) for you

The book (of deeds) shall be placed. And you will find the criminals panicky, afraid of what it might contain. They will say, "Oh, pity on us! What a book! Nothing is missing in it! Every single thing _ minor as well as major _ has been listed!" They will find everything they ever did, described (in the book in detail). Your Lord will be unfair to no one

When We ordered the Angels to prostrate themselves before Adam, they all did _ except Iblees (Shaitan). He is a jinn and he defied the command of your Lord. Yet, instead of Me (Allah) you accept him (Shaitan) and his descendants, as friends _ even though they are the enemies. Evil is the final end of the evil doers
I did not let them witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor the creation of their own selves. I wouldn´t accept as aides those who lead men astray

That day He will say, "Go on! Scream and call (for help) all those you claimed were My partners". And call they would, indeed! But they shall receive no response! We shall place a barrier between them
The criminals (that day) will witness the hellfire, fearing that they will (inevitably) fall into it. They will find no way to escape
Surely, We have mentioned in this Qur´an all sorts of examples for the people. But man happens to be more bickersome than anything

Now that the guidance is here, nothing must keep people from believing and seeking forgiveness from their Lord. Else, the tradition of the earlier folks would be repeated, and they would come face to face with a severe torment

We sent the messengers only as bearers of glad tidings, and as warners. But the unbelievers quarrel. They attempt to refute the truth with baseless discussions. They mock My signs and that about which they´re being warned

Who could be worse than the one who turns away and shuns the signs of his Lord, even though he is being reminded of them? He forgets the kinds of deeds he has committed. Indeed, We have set a lid over their hearts; so they fail to understand (the Qur´an). There exists a heavy load in their ears. Therefore, you may call them towards the truth, but they shall not be led on to the right path

Your Lord is the most Forgiving; He is the Lord of Mercy. If He were to grab them over all (the sins) they gather He would punish them instantly. But, their time (of reckoning) is preordained. Beyond that, they shall find no refuge
We brought to ruin all those towns because they were wicked. We fixed a specific time for the destruction (of each town)
(And tell them) when Musa said to his attendant, "I will not give up. I will keep going till I reach the confluence of the rivers, even if it takes several years
They reached the confluence, but forgot the fish (they had with them). It slipped away and found its way into the sea
When they went past (the confluence) he (Musa) said to the attendant, "Prepare our meal. We have really suffered so much fatigue in this journey

The attendant replied, "Did you see what happened? We were relaxing upon that cliff and I lost sight of the fish! It was Shaitan! He made me forget to mention it. The fish mysteriously found its way into the sea
(Musa) said, "That (sign) is precisely what we were looking for!" So they retraced their steps and went back (to that cliff)
There, they met Our servant. We had showered Our mercy upon him, and had taught him (a special) knowledge
Musa asked, "May I follow you? Can you impart to me the (special) guidance you have been taught
He said, "I am sure you will not be able to bear me with patience
How can you remain patient about something you have no knowledge of
(Musa) said, "Allah willing, you will find me a patient person. I will not disobey you in any matter
He said, "You may accompany me but do not ask any questions until I bring the matter up myself
So they proceeded till they boarded a ship. The man drilled a hole (in its keel). (Musa) said, "You bore a hole in the ship to drown all its passengers. You have no doubt committed a dreadful act
(The man) said, "Did I not warn you? You will not be able to put up with me so patiently
(Musa) said, "Do not blame me. I forgot. Do not make me undergo such a trying situation
They proceeded again till they met a lad. The man killed him. (Musa) said, "You have taken an innocent life without any justification. Of course, you committed an evil act
(The man) said, "Did I not tell you? Indeed, you would be unable to bear me with patience
(Musa) said, "Don´t let me accompany you if I ask anything after this! There, you now have a reason (to part company)

The two men resumed (their journey), reached a town and requested food. The townfolks refused to put them up as guests. In the town, the man found a wall about ready to crumble. (The man) repaired it. (Musa) said, "Of course, if you wanted, you could have charged them for it
(The Man) said, "This is where we bid farewell to each other! I will give you the explanation of the things you could not endure
As for the ship, it belongs to some poor folks who operate it in the sea. I sought to make it defective; a king nearby, seizes all the (defect-free) ships forcibly
As for the boy, his parents are true believers. We feared that he would (grow up to) disobey them, oppress them and make them suffer tremendously
We wished that their Lord would grant them in exchange a just, honest and a more merciful (offspring)

And buried under the wall is a treasure. It belongs to two orphan brothers in town. Their father was pious! Your Lord decreed that (the boys) should discover (the treasure) when they attain the age of maturity. A mercy from your Lord. I did nothing of my own accord. That, in fact, was the reality which you witnessed but could not endure
They inquire about Dhul Qurnain. Say, "Here, I will tell you about him
We established him firmly in the land and laid at his disposal the means to obtain everything
He undertook a mission

And reached the land of the setting sun. He saw the sun setting behind the murky hot springs. And he found a people living there nearby. We said, "Oh Dhul Qurnain! You may punish them, or treat them nicely
He said, "We will punish the evil doer ourselves. Later, he returns to his Lord, Who will punish him with a woeful torture
(Dhul Qurnain said), "But the best of reward _ (paradise) _ is for the one who believes and acts righteously. We will treat him with kindness
Then he undertook another mission (eastward)
(And pressed on) till he reached the land of the rising sun. He found the sun rising upon a (primitive) people. We had not arranged any shelter for them against the sun
Such (was their state); and We knew exactly what he (Dhul Qurnain) possessed
Then he went on yet another mission
Until he reached a mountainous area and found in the valley a people who understood almost nothing
They said, "These Yajog and Majog run amock in the land. May we pay you a tax to have a barrier erected between them and us
Said, "(Thanks, but) the power my Lord has granted is enough (and far better)! Just help me with your manpower. I shall build a wall between them and you

Bring me blocks of steel." He blocked up the valley between the mountains (with a wall of steel) and said. "Now start a fire and blow (air through your bellows) till the wall becomes red hot." Then he said, "Bring me the molten copper to pour over the (iron) wall
The barbarians could neither scale (the wall) nor breach it
Said, "This is my Lord´s mercy upon you! (However) when the time comes for (the fulfillment of) my Lord´s promise, He will demolish it! My Lord´s promise is absolutely true
That day We will leave them rolling over each other (like waves), and then the trumpet will sound and We will gather them all together
And We shall display and bring within sight hell for the unbelievers
Those, whose eyes are sheathed (and insulated) against My reminder (the Qur´an) cannot stand even to listen to it
Did the unbelievers suppose that they can take _ instead of Me _ My slaves as their masters and get away with it? Indeed! To do them the honors, We have prepared hell
Say, "May we tell you about the worst of the losers
They are those who (in reality) squander away their efforts in the life of this world, yet regard their deeds to be good
Such are the ones who reject the signs of their Lord and the (forthcoming) meeting with Him. So their efforts amount to nothing. On the Day of Judgment, We shall assign them no weight at all
They shall have their reward _ hell. Because they disbelieved, and mocked My signs and My messengers
On the other hand, those who believe and do good deeds shall be honored with (the gift of) the gardens of paradise
There they shall live forever. They shall never desire to depart
Say, "Had the ocean served as ink to write about Allah, then surely the ocean would run out, but the narrative about Allah would not. Even if We supplied that much more ink as a refill

Say, "Surely, I am just a man like you. Revelation has been sent to me that your God is only one God! Hence, those hoping to meet their Lord should seek the righteous acts, and should not accept any partners in the worship of their Lord
Kaaf, Ya, Ain, Saad
This is the account of the blessings of your Lord upon Zakaria, His servant
When once he addressed his Lord in a soft voice
Said, "Lord! My bones have weakened and my head has lit up with the gray hair (of old age). I haven´t so far been denied anything I ever prayed to You for
I am concerned for my followers after my death. My wife is barren. But, please Lord! Grant me by Your grace a successor (son)
One who may inherit from me and from the family of Yaqub, and Lord, please let him be amongst those with whom You are well-pleased
Oh Zakaria, We give you the good news of a son. His name shall be Yahya! Never before have We created anyone with his kind of qualities
Said, "Lord! How could I have a son now? My wife is barren and I have attained a ripe old age
Said, "That shall be!" Your Lord said, "This is really easy for Me! I also gave you existence earlier when you were nothing
Said, "Lord! Assign a sign for me." Said, "Despite being healthy, you shall be unable to speak for three days. That shall be your sign
He emerged from the chamber, and gestured to his followers asking them to sing the praises (of Allah), morning and evening
Oh Yahya! Hold on to the book with all your might!" We gave him the wisdom even as a lad
And by Our grace, We granted him compassion and purity; he was pious
He was devoted and kind to his parents; not defiant or arrogant
Peace be upon him, the day he was born! The day he died! And the day he shall be brought back to life
And mention Mary in your narration. Once she excused herself from her family and retired to the eastern wing of the house
She drew the curtain behind her and there, We sent Our spirit (angel) to her! It appeared before her in the figure of a full grown man
She cried out, "I seek the protection of Rehman (the Merciful) from you, if you are a God-fearing person
He said, "What I am, is a messenger of your Lord to bestow upon you a pious son
Said, "How might I have a son? No man has ever touched me, nor am I a woman of loose morals
Said "It shall be! Your Lord says ´It is really too easy for Me´! It is preordained and shall come to pass, so as to make him a sign for the humankind and a blessing from Us´
She conceived and moved to a place far away
The distress of labor brought her under a date-palm tree. She said to herself, "I wish I was dead, long gone and forgotten before this ever happened
He (the angel) called her from close by, "Do not feel sorry for yourself. Your Lord has issued forth a spring right close to where you are
Shake the trunk of the date tree. Moist ripe dates will break loose and fall down
Eat, drink and stay calm. Should any one happen to pass by, tell him you are observing a fast for the sake of Rehman, (the Merciful), and hence shall not talk to anyone
She returned to her folks carrying him (the baby). They said, "Oh Mary! What an unprecedented act have you committed
Oh sister of Haroon! Your father was not wicked! Nor was your mother a loose woman
She pointed towards the infant. They said, "How can we converse with an infant lying in a crib
The infant said, "I am the servant of Allah! He appointed me His messenger, and granted me the gospel
He blessed me wherever I might happen to be, and has ordered me to enjoin the ´salat´ and the ´zakat´ as long as I am alive
(I am) devoted to my mother, not hapless and arrogant
Peace upon me the day I was born. The day I shall die. And the day I shall be brought back to life
Such was Jesus, the son of Mary! This is the real truth about him, which they dispute
It is not befitting of Allah to have a son. Exalted is He! Having decided the matter, He merely tells it, "Be!" Hence it becomes
Indeed, Allah is my Lord as well as your Lord! So worship Him. That is the straight path
Groups have disputed amongst themselves regarding the day (of judgment). Witnessing that great day shall be disastrous for those who deny its coming
On the day they shall come to Us, their vision and hearing shall be sharper! Today the evil-doers are clearly lost in their misguidance
Warn them of the regretful embarrassment of the day when the matter shall be decided and put to rest! Today they are in heedless and neglectful denial, and they do not believe
We shall inherit the earth, including all that is upon it. Towards Us they all shall return
And mention Ibraheem in the book; he was a truthful person and a prophet
He said to his father, "Oh Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees, nor hears, nor can protect you from anything
Oh Father, true knowledge did not come to you, but has come to me. So follow me, I shall lead you along the balanced path
Oh Father, do not obey Shaitan. Indeed, Shaitan is disobedient to Rehman
I am worried, Oh Father, that a great torment might fall upon you from Rehman, and that you might end up as a comrade of Shaitan
He said, "Have you turned away from your gods, oh Ibraheem? Desist, for if you do not, I shall stone you to death. Out of my sight, now
Said, "Peace be upon you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you. He is really very kind to me
I hereby wash my hands of you, and those you call gods besides Allah. I will worship my Lord! I am confident, If I pray to Him, I shall not be deprived
After he abandoned them along with those whom they called gods beside Allah, We gave him Ishaq and Yaqub. We appointed each of them a prophet
We showered Our blessings upon them and gave them high honor
And mention Musa in the book. He was really chosen, a prophet and a messenger
We called him out from the right side of the mountain Toor, and pulled him close, so as to grant him a private audience
And We gave his brother, Haroon, to him as a prophet, a blessing from Us
And mention Ismail in the book. Indeed, he was true to his words, a prophet and a messenger
He obligated ´salat´ and ´zakat´ upon his family. In the eyes of his Lord, he was an adorable person
And in the book, mention Idrees. Indeed, he was a truthful person and a prophet
We raised him to an exalted status

These are the ones Allah showered His blessings upon. These prophets were the descendants of Adam, and the descendants of those We boarded on the boat with Nooh. They were the descendants of Ibraheem and Ismail. Those were the ones We picked for Our guidance! Such were they that when Our verses were recited to them, they fell prostrate on the ground, tears welling up in their eyes
They were succeeded by ignorant ones, those who squandered their "salat´ and followed their whims and the pleasures of the flesh. Their just deserts shall soon catch up with them
Except those who repent, believe, and perform good deeds. They will enter paradise. They will not be dealt with unfairly
Rehman has promised this paradise to His servants for eternity, in exchange for their belief in the unseen. Surely His promise will be fulfilled
In it, they shall hear nothing vulgar; only peace! There, each day and each night, their due portion (sustenance) shall be delivered to them
Such is the paradise, which We will allow only Our pious servants to inherit
(Angels said), "We descend only when ordered by your Lord. To Him belongs all that lies before us, behind us, and in between. Your Lord is not the One to forget
He is the sustainer of the heavens and the earth, and all else in between. So worship Him in steadfast obedience. Do you know any other comparable to Him
(Yet), man says "When I am dead, will I emerge back to life again
Does man not recall? It was We Who created him earlier, when he was nothing
By your Lord! Very definitely! We shall gather them and the Shaitans together. Then, certainly, We shall collect them all around the hellfire, in a manner that they shall be crawling on their knees
Thereafter, We shall definitely bring forth from each group of people the one who had been the most ardent and rebellious opponent of Rehman
Of course, We know very well who amongst them deserves to burn in hell
There isn´t any of you who can avoid passing by the hellfire. Your Lord has made this incumbent upon Himself
Then, We will let the transgressors fall tumbling down into it, but We will rescue those who have been heedful and pious

When Our clear lucid verses are recited, those who disbelieve the verses taunt those who believe by saying, "Which of the two of us has a better abode, and enjoys and mingles with better and more distinguished company
Many groups have We destroyed prior to them. They were better equipped, better furnished and better in appearance

Say, "Rehman gives leeway to those who indulge in gross negligence until they get to see that which is promised to be their lot, either the punishment (in this world) or the hour (of judgment)! They would soon realise whose status is lower! Whose allies are weaker
Allah increases in guidance those who are on the straight path, and the results of their good deeds are better with Allah in terms of rewards and consequences
Did you see the one who has chosen to deny Our signs and yet says, "I shall definitely be granted wealth and children
Has he peeked into the unseen? or has he entered into a contract with Rehman
Indeed not! Rather, We are recording everything he says. We shall extend his punishment a great deal further
We shall repossess all that he owns. And We shall bring him out all alone
They have taken gods other than Allah, so that they may have supporters
No! Indeed, their false gods will disown their worship, and they will become adversaries
Do you not notice? We send the Shaitans upon the disbelievers, and they continually incite and instigate them
Do not be impatient with them. We are counting down their days
That day, We will gather the pious (God-fearing) as guests of Rehman
While the sinners will be like thirst-stricken animals, whom We will shove towards the hellfire
No one has the ability to intervene, except those whom Rehman has promised
What? Do they say Rehman (God) has a son
They have surely brought forth a grave thing
So grave, indeed, that it may cause the earth to explode into pieces! Or the mountains may come tumbling down! Or the heavens might just crack asunder
They have dared to assign a son for Rehman
It is not befitting for Rehman to have a son
Every being in the heavens and on the earth shall come before Rehman as a slave
He is aware of their exact number, and He has counted them all up
On the Day of Judgment, each of them shall arrive all alone, and shall be on his own
And of course, Rehman will instill with love, the hearts of those who believe and do the righteous deeds
We have made this (Quran) easy for you, in your own language, in order that you may give the glad tidings to the pious and the God-fearing. With it, you may warn those that are belligerent
Many a people have We destroyed before them. So now, can you sense even a faint sign of their existence, or hear even a wisp of their tale
Ta, Ha
We have revealed to you this Qur´an, not to cause you distress
Rather, it is a memorandum _ (an advisory) _ for the one who fears
A communiqué from the Creator of the earth and the celestial heavens
Rehman, (the most magnificent), mounted the throne (and governs the universe majestically)
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on the earth, whatever lies between them, and whatever exists under (the surface of the earth)
You call Him out loud. (But remember), He knows even the most intimate thoughts _ thoughts that remain hidden (and unexpressed) forever
He is Allah! There is no god but He; His are all the beautiful names
Is the story of Musa known to you
When he spotted a campfire, he said to his family, "I notice a fire! Perhaps, I can bring a live coal from there (to start our own fire), or obtain directions (for the road ahead)
When he approached (the site of) the campfire, We called out to him, "Oh Musa
It is I, your Lord! Take your shoes off! You happen to be in the holy valley of Toah
I chose you! So listen to what is being revealed
Indeed, I am the One _ Allah! There is no god except Me! So obey Me and establish the ´salat´ (prayers) to remember Me
In fact, the hour (of Judgment) is sure to arrive! I want to keep (its time) undisclosed, so that every soul may be rewarded in accordance with its efforts
Hence, Do not ever let an unbeliever _ the one following his own whims _ dissuade you from it (the belief in the afterlife), lest you perish
And what is that (you hold) in your right (hand), oh Musa
Said, "It is my stick. I lean on it to rest my weight, and with it I chop off the leaves to feed my cattle. It also has other uses for me
Said, "Throw it down, Oh Musa
So he threw it down, and all of a sudden, it became a snake creeping around (swiftly)
(Allah) said, "Grab it, and do not be afraid. We will change it back to its earlier state
And place your hand in your armpit. (As you pull your hand out) it will appear dazzling white without any discomfort. Another sign
To show you (but just two of) Our great signs
Go to the pharaoh! He has exceeded (every) limit
(Musa) said, "Lord, unlock my heart
And make my task easy for me
And correct my speech impediment
(So) they understand my words
And appoint one of my family members (as an aide) to help me
My brother, Haroon
With him, bolster my strength
And make him a partner in my mission
So, we may glorify You a lot
And talk about You a lot
And certainly, You are watching over us
Said, "You are being granted your requests, oh Musa
We, in fact, conferred favors upon you at other times, too
When We inspired your mother by implanting an idea in her mind

(Saying) "Put (the child) in a box and push (the box) down the river. It will hurl (the box) ashore, where Our enemy _ his and Mine _ will pick him up." I bestowed love upon you, so you may be raised under My watchful eye

(Remember) when your sister walked (along the box) and said to those who found the child, "Shall I guide you to a wet nurse for him?" Thus We sent you back to your mother, to soothe her and to keep her from grieving. Then you killed a man. We rescued you from that distress. We had you go through a terrible ordeal. You lived with the people of Madyan a number of years. And now, you have arrived here at just the right (preordained) time
Oh Musa, I have selected you specifically for My sake
So proceed with My signs, both of you _ you and your brother. Do not become lax in remembering Me
Go to the pharaoh! Indeed, he has transgressed
But speak to him in an affable manner. Maybe he will heed, and fear (Allah)
They said, "Our Lord! We are afraid that he will let loose his rage upon us and will oppress us
Said, "Have no fear! I am with you, watching over and listening

So go to him and say, "We are the messengers of your Lord! Therefore, let the Israelites go with us and do not torture them. We have already brought you the proof from your Lord! Peace is upon him, who follows the guidance
Indeed, it has been revealed to us that punishment awaits the one who denies and turns away
(The pharaoh) asked, "So then, who is your Lord, oh Musa
Said, "The One Who gave each (existing) thing its nature and form, then guided it along
(The pharaoh) asked, "Then, what about the generations of yester years
Musa said, "The facts about them are known to my Lord and recorded in a book. He neither errs nor forgets
The same One Who made the earth your (safe) haven, carved roads in it for you, and sent water down from the sky." With that (water), We bring out vegetation of many diverse kinds
Eat! And feed your cattle, too. Indeed, in it is a sign for those who (accept) reason
We created you from this (very) earth. Into it We shall have you return, and from it We shall bring you out a second time
Surely, We had him look at all Our signs, but he rejected (them all) and refused (to believe)
(The pharaoh) said, "Are you here to drive us out of our land with your magic, oh Musa

And added, "Of course, we can perform that kind of magic too. So, go ahead! For our encounter pick a time and place _ a neutral location (accessible to all). We will not fail to show up. Nor should you
(Musa) said, "Let the coming festival day be the appointed date, and let the people gather at high noon
So, the pharaoh withdrew and with craftiness, put together a scheme, and then he arrived
Musa said to them. "Woe unto you! Do not make up lies against Allah. He will annihilate you (all) with a torment. Whoever invents lies against Allah fails
At that point, they began to dispute among themselves and held secret talks
At length they said, "These two are just magicians trying to evict you from your land by their spells. They want to deprive you of your exemplary way of life
So rally all your tricks, then act in unison. Whoever triumphs today will prosper
They said, "Oh Musa, either you cast (your spell) first, or else let us be the first to cast (the spell)
(Musa) said, "No! You go first. Then suddenly, because of their spell, it appeared to him that their ropes and sticks (were snakes and) were creeping about swiftly
A sense of fear came over Musa
We said, "Do not be afraid. You will be the one to triumph, for sure

Throw down the stick in your right hand. It will gobble up the spell they have cast. What they have conjured up is only a trick of the magicians, and magicians never succeed when they come (to face the truth)
The magicians lost out, threw themselves down on the ground prostrate, and said, "We accept the Lord of Haroon and Musa

The pharaoh said, "You believed him, even though I did not permit you? Obviously, he is your master who has taught you the magic! Now, I will definitely chop off your hands and feet on opposite sides and then crucify you on the trunk of the date-palm tree. You will soon know which one of us awards the severer and the more lasting punishment

They said, "In the face of the clear signs that have come to us, we will not prefer you to the One Who has created us. So do whatever you decree. Surely, you exercise control (only) in the life of this world
We have really believed in our Lord! So He may forgive our sins, as well as the magic you compelled us to perform. Allah is better, and the Immortal
Indeed, hell is for the one who comes to his Lord as a criminal. There, he will never die _ nor live
The exalted ranks are for those who come to their Lord as believers, having done righteous deeds
(As also) the elevated gardens, through which run the rivers. There, they shall live forever! This is the reward for those who endeavor to purify themselves
Indeed, We revealed to Musa, "Go and take My servants with you. Strike a dry path through the sea. Do not be frightened of being overtaken (by the Pharaoh in hot pursuit), nor be afraid (of the sea)
The pharaoh pursued them with his army. They were drowned by that which engulfed them from all sides
The pharaoh led his nation astray _ did not guide well
Oh Children of Israel! We rescued you from your enemy, granted you an audience by the right side of the mountain ´Toor´, and sent down the ´munna´ and the ´salwa´ for you
Eat the wholesome food We have provided, but do not be overly excessive. Else, My wrath will come down upon you. Surely, the one upon whom lands My fury, comes tumbling down
Yet, undoubtedly, I am the One Who grants forgiveness to anyone who repents, believes and acts righteously; and then stays steadfast (till death)
(Allah asked), "What made you come (to Me) ahead of your people, oh Musa
Said, "They´re coming right behind. I hurried towards You, Lord, so You may be pleased
(Allah) said, "After you left, We subjected your people to a test. Saamari led them astray

So Musa returned to his nation, angry and aggrieved, and said, "Oh my people, did your Lord not make you excellent promises? Has it been too long for you? Or do you just want the fury of your Lord to land on you? Is that why you broke your pledge with me

They said, "We did not willfully opt to break our promise to you. In fact, the burden of carrying people´s jewelry had worn us down. So we unloaded it (into the fire). Likewise, Saamari threw it down, too
Then, he shaped the gold into the figure of a calf, and it mooed like one! People cried out, "This is your God. The God of Musa. He forgot (to mention it)
Did they not see that it did not respond to them at all? Nor did it have the ability to hurt them, or help them
Even though Haroon had told them earlier, "Oh my people! You are being tested with it (the calf). Really, your Lord is the most Merciful. So follow me, all of you! And obey my command
They said, "We will not quit worshipping (the calf) until Musa comes back
Musa (when he returned) said, "Oh Haroon, when you saw them going astray, what held you back
Why did you not follow me? Did you disobey my instructions
Haroon said, "Oh son of my mother! Do not tug at my beard, nor pull my hair! I was afraid you would blame me and say ´You caused a split among the Israelites, and did not follow my instruction.´
Said, "And what about you, Oh Saamari
(Saamari) said, "I realized what others failed to. So I collected a handful (of dust) from the footmarks of the prophets and tossed it on the calf. That is what my self prompted me to do

(Musa) said, "Go! This is (the punishment) for you: in this life you will (continually) utter ´Do not touch me´, and you have an appointment (in the afterlife) which you cannot skip. Now watch that god of yours, upon whose worship you insisted. We will surely melt it down, then scatter it around in the ocean
As a matter of fact, Allah (alone) is your God! Besides Him there is no other god, and His knowledge extends over all things
Thus, We narrate to you the tales of what went on earlier. We have granted you this (book of) advisement from Ourselves
Indeed, those ignoring it shall bear a burdensome punishment on the Day of Judgment
They shall forever remain in it _ (that condition of torment). Baneful shall be their burden on the Day of Judgment
The day the trumpet sounds will be the day We will gather the criminals, their eyes agape with fright
Among themselves they will whisper, "You stayed (on the earth) only ten days
Of course We know very well what they shall say. The most accurate among them will say, "You stayed there for just a day
They are asking you about the mountains. Tell them, "My Lord will blow them up into fine dust
He will turn (this earth) into a plain wasteland
You will not find any ridges or cracks on it

On that day, they will (meekly) respond to the convener _ (the angel) _ who shall face no hindrance. In the presence of Rehman, voices will drop to a subdued hush. You shall hear nothing but faint whispers
That day, mediation shall benefit no one, unless Rehman grants permission, and about whom He pleases to hear (favorable) remarks
He knows all that lies ahead of them as well as everything about their past. Others do not know at all
All heads will bow before the Eternally Alive and the Ever-lasting. Anyone carrying a burden of having committed an injustice shall fail miserably
(Whereas) those who had acted righteously _ provided they had believed _ shall have no fear of being wronged or short changed
Thus, We revealed this Qur´an in Arabic. In it We have defined sharply the promises and the threats. Maybe they will fear (Allah), or it _ (the Qur´an) _ will bring back the remembrance (of Allah)
Allah, the Genuine Emperor, is the most Exalted! Do not be in a hurry to repeat (the fresh verses of) the Qur´an before the revelations conclude. Say, "Lord, enhance me in knowledge
Earlier, We had entrusted Adam with a task, but his memory lapsed. We did not find in him the firmness of resolve
(Remember)! We said to the angels, "Fall down prostrate before Adam!" And they all fell prostrate, except Iblees (Shaitan). He refused
So We said, "Oh Adam, that one, surely, is your and your wife´s enemy. Now do not let him drive you out of paradise, lest you feel distressed
Of course, here (in paradise), it is your (privilege) that you do not go hungry, nor are you unclad
And here you are not thirsty, troubled by the (sultry sweltering) sun
Yet Shaitan whispered (and aroused) doubts in his mind saying, "Oh Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality, and the domain that has no demise

Both of them _ (Adam and his wife) _ ate its fruit and their genitalia became visible to them. With the leaves of the Garden of Eden they began to cover themselves. Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray
Later, his Lord favored him, granted him forgiveness and guided him

(Allah) said, "Get down from here! Both of you _ (Adam and Shaitan)! You are each other´s enemy. Whoever follows the guidance _ when the guidance from Me arrives _ will not go astray, and will not be miserable
While a wretched (unwholesome) livelihood will be the lot of the one who turns away from My advice and warning. He will be blind when We round him up on the Day of Judgment
He shall say, "Lord, why did You raise me blind? I used to be endowed with eyesight
Allah will say, "Much the same as you ignored My signs when they came to you! Befittingly, today you are being ignored
This is how We chastise the one who exceeds the bounds, and ignores the signs of his Lord. The punishment of the afterlife is far worse and ever persisting
Many towns have We destroyed before them. Did that fact not teach them? They walk through those ruins! There are surely signs in it for those with intellect
The word of your Lord has been proclaimed! Had it not been, and if it wasn´t essential and for a specific period, (then their doom and demise would be instant)

Therefore, with patience bear their remarks and chant the praises of your Lord before the sun rises, before it sets, and during the night. Glorify Him in the morning and evening. Perhaps you will feel contented

Do not look (enviously) at the splendors of this life with which We have furnished some of their groups. It is (merely) to test them. The grants of your Lord (in the afterlife) are far better and ever lasting
Bid your family to observe the ´salat´, and stay steadfast upon it yourself. We do not seek sustenance from you. Indeed, We bestow sustenance. The final outcome hinges on piety
They say, "Why did he not bring us a sign?" Did clear proofs _ those narrated in the earlier scriptures _ not reach them

Had We, prior to sending him (Muhammad, SAW), ruined them with a disaster, they would have complained, "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs instead of being disgraced and humiliated
Say, "Each (soul) is in a state of waiting. You wait, too! Soon you will find out who is on the right path, and well-guided
Their reckoning has drawn closer, but people are turning away in unmindful ignorance
When a fresh narrative from their Lord reaches them, they (barely) hear it, then they resume their pastimes
Their minds absorbed in pleasures, the evil doers whisper under their breaths, "Isn´t he just a human being like you all? Will you then, succumb to his magic knowingly
The messenger said, "My Lord knows everything uttered in the heavens and on earth. He is the All-hearing and the All-knowing
And they said, "Vague meaningless dreams, or he has made it up, or he is a poet. Else, let him present to us a miracle like the earlier (messengers) did
Those towns _ the ones We destroyed in the past _ had also failed to believe. So now, will they believe
We have always commissioned men (as messengers) and sent revelations to them, even before your time. Should you not know (this fact), ask the people of the scriptures
We did not fashion their physiques, so as to enable them to live without food, nor did they live forever
Then, We fulfilled Our pledge and rescued them, and those whom We wished. We destroyed those who had exceeded their limits
We have sent you this book. In it are narrations about your own self. So why do you not understand
Many towns have We dashed into fragments. They were evil! Then We brought other nations in their place
When they experienced Our power, they suddenly began to flee
Do not run away! Return to your homes and the luxurious comforts you were given. You will be called (to account)
They said, "Misery to us! We surely were evil
They kept saying that right until We turned them into the plucked out harvest
We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between as an amusement (and a pastime)
Had We wanted just to have fun, and if We were (given to) doing that, We would have done so all by Ourselves
On the contrary, We run the truth against falsehood, over which it triumphs. In time, the falsehood is bound to come to naught! Misery to you for what you attribute
Every living being in the heavens and on earth belongs to Him, and no one in His presence _ either out of pride or regret _ shies away from worshipping Him
All day and all night, they chant His praises. They do not relent
Have they accepted other gods on the earth? Do those other gods bring the dead back to life
The heavens and the earth would run into chaos had there been other gods beside Allah. Exalted is Allah, the Lord of the heavenly throne, far above what they utter
He is not answerable for His actions, while all others are (to Him)

Have they accepted other gods beside Him? Say, "Present your proof! Here is this reminder (the Qur´an) for those with me, and there are the scriptures for those before me." Most people actually do not know the truth, and so they ignore
Never was there a messenger before you to whom We did not reveal, "There is no god except Me, so worship Me (exclusively)
They say, "Rehman has adopted a son!" Glorified is He! Rather, they are all (just His) honored servants
They dare not initiate an audience with Him, and they diligently carry out His orders

He knows everything that lies ahead of them and everything about their past. They do not intercede for anyone except for those He is pleased with. They are attentive! And stand in awe and reverence of Him
We will award hell to anyone amongst them who says, "I am a god besides Him." That is how We punish the transgressors
Do the unbelievers not consider the fact that the heavens and the earth were joined together? We split them asunder! And from water, We created every living being! Do they not believe (that)
We pitched mountains firmly on the earth, lest it makes them sway. (Between the mountains) We cut roads and paths, so they may find their way
And (for you), We deemed the sky to be a safe and secure ceiling. Yet, these are the signs they overlook
And He is the One Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Each is afloat in its orbit
We have never bestowed immortality upon any human, including you, (Oh Muhammad, SAW). So you will die! But will they live forever
Every living being must taste death! We put you through trials, and We test all of you with (different) things _ bad as well as good! Then, towards Us, you shall all return
When the unbelievers see you, they treat you with scorn, (saying), "Is he the one who speaks (ill) of our gods?" While they themselves are such a sort that they refuse to accept any mention of Rehman
Man is created hasty. Very soon, I will have you see My signs! Do not be in such haste
And they say, "If you are truthful, tell us. When will that promise (of the afterlife) come about
If the unbelievers could only imagine the moment when they will struggle in vain to ward off the fire from their faces and their backs! They shall have no help
It will come upon them all of a sudden, and it will bewilder them. They will be unable to turn it away, and they shall have no respite (another chance)
During earlier times, too, they made fun of the messengers. But the mockery came back to haunt (and surround) those who used to mock
Say, "Who will watch over you during the night and the day, and protect you against (the wrath of) Rehman?" No! In fact, they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord
Or do they have other gods to guard them against Us? Those ´gods´ are unable to help even their own selves. Nor can they be guarded against Us
Rather, We had them and their forefathers enjoy (life) till they grew old. Do they not notice? We keep on shrinking the land from all sides. So then, can they triumph
Say, "The fact is, by this revelation I warn you!" But the deaf do not hear what they are being warned against
Even if a whiff of Our punishment were to hit them, they would surely cry out, "Oh misery to us, we were indeed the evil doers

We will indeed bring out the scales of justice on the Day of Judgment. No soul shall be wronged a bit. We will bring out (into focus) all deeds, even those (insignificant enough to be) worth a tiny bit of a mustard seed. And Our presence shall suffice to hold the reckoning
We had indeed granted Musa and Haroon the proof, the illuminating light and the (right) advice for those who fear
Those who fear their unseen Lord and dread the hour of judgment
This (Qur´an), now, is the blessed narration We have sent! So then, are you refusing to acknowledge it
Much earlier, We granted Ibraheem the maturity of mind
When he once said to his father and his people, "What are these statues you are worshipping so devoutly
They replied, "We found our forefathers praying to them
Said, "Surely, you and your forefathers were gravely misguided
They said, "Are you expressing your real views or are you just kidding
Indeed not! Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One Who brought them into being. I bear witness to this (Truth)
Said, "I swear by Allah, I have plans for your idols when you go away and leave them
So he battered them to pieces, except the one most prominent. Maybe they would turn to it
They said, "Who did this to our gods? He is really very cruel
Some said, "We heard a lad called Ibraheem talking about them
They said, "Bring him out to face the people. So they may observe (his fate)
They asked, "Did you do that to our gods, oh Ibraheem
Said, "Rather, this one, their chief did that! Therefore, ask them if they can talk
They felt a pinch of conscience and (their inner voice) said, "Really, it is you who is being unjust
But they brushed that thought aside and said, "Of course, they do not talk! And you know it
He said, "Why then do you worship those besides Allah. They grant you no benefits, nor inflict any harm
Damn you, and those you worship beside Allah! Do you not understand at all
They cried, "Burn him at the stake! Rush to the aid of your gods! Act, if you will
We commanded, "Oh fire, simmer down, and let there be peace upon Ibraheem
They wanted to hurt him, but We caused them to be the real losers
Towards the blessed land, We had him and Loot escape. We had blessed it for the whole world
We gave Ibraheem a present: a son, Ishaq and (the grandson), Yaqub. We made each of them righteous

We made them both the patriarch _the leaders. As per Our instructions, they guided their people, and We revealed to them the acts of righteousness: the establishing of ´salat´ and the paying of "zakat". Both of them were Our devotees
As for Loot, We gave him wisdom and knowledge and rescued him from the people who committed the gravest of sins. They were indeed a very evil people
We admitted (Loot) into Our mercy; he was amongst the righteous
And prior to that, Nooh prayed to Us and We responded. We saved him and his family from a great torment
We came to his aid against a nation that had denied Our signs. They were an evil people, indeed. So We drowned them all _ every single one of them
And don´t forget Daood and Sulaiman as they sat in judgment, hearing the case of the field that had been overrun at night by goats of other folks. We were overseeing their judgment
We unveiled (the right ruling) to Sulaiman. We had granted wisdom and courage to both. For Daood, We had tamed the mountains and the birds. They used to chant praises with him! It was We Who did that
It was We Who taught him the art of making metal armors for you, so you may shield yourself during battles. But then, are you grateful
And for Sulaiman, (We tamed) the violent winds. Upon his orders they rushed towards the land We had blessed. We have the knowledge of all things
Groups of Shaitans (those We tamed), used to sea dive for him. Besides that, they performed other duties for him. We were the guardian over them
(And also) Ayub! He called his Lord, "An agony has befallen me while You are absolutely the most Merciful of all who show mercy
We heard his prayers, relieved him of his agony and reunited him with his family. We increased his family as a blessing from Us, and as an inducement for the worshippers
And (We also heard) Ismail, Idrees and Dhul Qifl. They were all patient men
And We admitted them into Our mercy. They were all righteous

And remember the one (who is well known because) of the fish. He left his town in exasperation, and he thought that We would fail to take him to task. Eventually, from the darkness he called, "There is no god but You. Exalted are You! Surely I was the offender
We responded and relieved his grief. That is how We relieve the believers
Zakaria called his Lord, (saying), "Lord, do not leave me alone (child less). You are the best of those who receive the heritage

We responded and granted him Yahya. We remedied (the condition of) his wife! All these (messengers) eagerly rushed towards the righteous acts, and prayed to Us with fear and longing. They all were humbly submissive to Us
(As also) that lady who had guarded her virginity. We breathed Our spirit into her body, and turned her and her son into a sign for the world
Listen! This human race of yours is really a single nation and I am your Lord, so worship Me exclusively
But they divided up their beliefs (and devotion) amongst themselves. All must return to Us
The efforts of anyone who performed the righteous acts _ provided he is a believer _ will not go unrecognized. Indeed, We are writing (everything) down
And forbidden it is for the town We have destroyed to bounce back
Until (the time), the ´Yajog´ and the ´Majog´ are let loose. They will begin to spring out from every hill

As the promise of that certainty _ (the reckoning) _ looms closer, the eyes of the unbelievers will be glazed and agape (with horror). They will cry out, "Oh misery to us, we stayed unmindful of this. Rather, we were the evil doers
Indeed! You, and those you used to worship besides Allah, shall serve as fuel for the hellfire, which you shall have to enter
Had they been gods, they would not end up here (in hell). Now, they shall stay here forever
There, wheezing (amid moans and shrieks) shall be their mode of breathing. In hell, they shall not hear anything (else)
But those, for whom the decree of joy and happiness had been issued by Us, will be spared the above fate
(In paradise), they shall not hear even the faint whimper of hell. Amid what they desire and yearn, they shall live for ever
That great anxiety will not afflict them. The angels will greet them (saying), "Today is your day, the one you had been promised

That day We will fold up the heavens like pages folded in a book. Then, We will begin the creation anew just as We had started it in the first instance. This is a promise incumbent upon Us. We are definitely going to fulfill (Our promise)
We, in fact, revealed in the "Zaboor" _ (the book revealed to Da´ood) _ following Our warnings, that only My righteous servants shall inherit the earth
In that, surely, is the message for the nation that prays
We have sent you only as mercy for the entire world
Say, "It has been revealed to me that your God, for sure, is that One true God. So then, are you ready to submit, and obey
If they turn their backs, say, "I have notified you _ all of you, together. I have no idea whether that which is being promised to you, (the day of Reckoning), is close by or far in the future
Of course, He knows that which is spoken aloud, as well as the thoughts you conceal
I do not know. It (the respite) maybe a trial for you, or else an enjoyment for a brief while
(Eventually), the messengers said, "Lord! Pass Your infallible verdict! And our Lord, the Beneficent, is our Advocate against every lie you utter
Oh you people! Fear your Lord! Indeed, the jolt of that hour (of Judgment) is a terrible thing

On that day _ (the Day of Judgment) _ you will see every breast feeding mother oblivious of her suckling infant! Every pregnant female would abort her fetus! And people would appear to be drunk although they would not be drunk! The punishment of Allah would indeed be that severe
Some people argue about Allah, although they have no knowledge. They tag along every defiant Shaitan
About whom it has been decreed, that he will lead astray anyone who abides by him, and that he will steer his flock straight into the torment of hellfire

Oh you people! Should you be in doubt about the resurrection, consider this: it is We Who created you (first) from dust and then (in stages) from semen to a clinging clot of blood, and then to a small chunk of flesh _ formed as well as unformed. (We tell you this) in order to explain to you the truth. In the womb, We keep installed whomever We want for a fixed time. Then, We bring you out as an infant, and let you obtain your full potential. Some of you die young while others are diverted to the age of weakness (and senility) _ the age when (once again) they know nothing after having learnt a few things. You observe the land dry and barren. Then, as soon as We send rain water down (it comes alive), it stirs, swells up and starts producing all sorts of delightful vegetation
That is so because Allah is the absolute Reality! And because He grants life back to the dead! He is capable of accomplishing everything
(Because it proves) that the hour of judgment is surely bound to come! No doubt about that! And that Allah will resurrect all (the dead) in their graves
Some people argue about Allah, although they do not have any knowledge, guidance or an illuminating book

Arching their necks conceitedly, they misguide people and drive them away from the path of Allah. Disgrace awaits them in this life, and on the Day of Judgment We shall have them taste the torture by fire
This is what your own hands have wrought. Surely, Allah does not oppress His servants

There are some people who worship Allah, but stay on the sidelines. If something good happens to them they are contented. But as soon as they are placed in a situation of trial, they undergo an about face and turn away. They lose out in this world, and also in the next! That, surely is a real loss
Instead of Allah, they pray to such deities that can inflict no harm, and award no benefits. That is surely the worst kind of misguidance
They pray to the one whose harm outweighs the benefits. Evil, indeed, is such a patron, and evil is such a companion
Allah will surely admit those who believe and act righteously into paradise. Rivers run right through it. Allah does what He wills

If anyone thinks that Allah will fail to help him (Muhammad, SAW) in this life and in the afterlife, then let that someone stretch his means to reach the heavens and traverse it. Let him see if his tricks can negate anything, including that which angers him
Thus, We send down the revealing verses. Surely, Allah guides whomever He wants

On the Day of the Judgment, Allah will surely settle the differences between the believers on the one hand, and the Jews, the Sabians, the Christians and the polytheists on the other. Allah is the Witness to all things

Do you not observe that everyone (and everything) in the heavens and on the earth falls prostrate before Allah: the sun and the moon, the stars and the mountains, the trees and the beasts, and a lot of people, too! Punishment has become warranted for many others (who do not prostrate). There is no honor for the one whom Allah humiliates. Undoubtedly, Allah does what He wills

These are the two rival groups _ (those who prostrate before Allah, and those who do not). They disagree about Allah. Garments made from fire have been readied for the unbelievers. Boiling water will be poured over their heads
Their skins and (even) their insides will melt away
Steel clubs shall be there (to restrain them)
Each time they emerge to escape the distress, they will be thrown right back into it. (They will be told), "Taste the torment of fire

(On the other hand), Allah will surely usher into paradise _ through which run the rivers _ all those who believe and do the righteous acts. They will don gold bracelets and pearls, and their garments shall be made of silk
They were led towards the pious speech (in this life), and towards the path of the One most Worthy of praise
